head.title: The First Killing of the Year

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: The First Killing of the Year

abstract.p: Dickens Desir of Brooklyn becomes first homicide victim of year when he is shot at about 3:25 am by assailant who escapes (S)

block.p: The first homicide victim of the year was a Brooklyn man who intervened on behalf of his brother-in-law in a dispute and was shot twice in the back, the police said.

The victim, Dickens Desir, 31, of 615 Rugby Road, was shot at about 3:25 a.m. yesterday in front of 1249 Ocean Avenue and died at Kings County Hospital at 8:32 a.m., said Sgt. Brian J. Burke, a police spokesman. The police described his assailant as a 6-foot-tall, 260-pound man between 28 and 32 years old.
